citation.article-title: Acidilobus aceticus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel anaerobic thermoacidophilic archaeon from continental hot vents in Kamchatka.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acidilobus aceticus sp. nov.
Acidilobus aceticus (a.ce'ti.cus. L. masc. adj. aceticus producing acetate)
Cells are non-motile, regular to irregular cocci approximately 1-2 μm in diameter.
The cell envelope consists of an S-layer attached to the cytoplasmic membrane.
Growth occurs in the temperature range 60-92 °C (optimum at 85 °C) and in the pH range 2.0-6.0 (optimum at 3.8).
Yeast extract, beef extract, soya extract and starch may serve as growth substrates.
Elemental sulfur stimulates growth on yeast extract but is not obligately required.
Growth products are acetate and, in the presence of S0, H2S.
Resistant to penicillin, streptomycin and chloramphenicol.
The source of isolation was a solfataric field near the Moutnovski volcano, Kamchatka.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 53.8 mol%.
The type strain is Acidilobus aceticus 1904T (=DSM 11585T).
